intro: Pentacalia jelskii, commonly known as the Jelskii's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
